item.title: Which LLMs are best at using tools? OpenAI > Claude > Mixtral > Mistral Which others ones should we benchmark?
item.description:
Which LLMs are best at using tools?

OpenAI > Claude > Mixtral > Mistral

Which others ones should we benchmark?


LangChain:‚ÄÇ‚öôÔ∏è Agents are the ‚Äúkiller‚Äù LLM app, but building and evaluating agents is hard.

A huge part of agents is tool use, but there aren't enough open-source tool use benchmarks out there.

Today, we are excited to release four new test environments for benchmarking LLMs‚Äô ability to‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1737515077807620499
item.author: LangChain

item.title: RT Harrison Chase: My favorite benchmark here is the "Multiverse Math" dataset ‚öîÔ∏èMistral is close to private models ‚è¨Private Models have low scores...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇHarrison Chase
My favorite benchmark here is the "Multiverse Math" dataset

‚öîÔ∏èMistral is close to private models
‚è¨Private Models have low scores
üìâMore recent private models perform worse

Why?

Hypothesis: better models bias more towards internal knowledge, rather than using tools

üßµ


LangChain:‚ÄÇ‚öôÔ∏è Agents are the ‚Äúkiller‚Äù LLM app, but building and evaluating agents is hard.

A huge part of agents is tool use, but there aren't enough open-source tool use benchmarks out there.

Today, we are excited to release four new test environments for benchmarking LLMs‚Äô ability to‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1737515077807620499

item.title: RT WFH: In April, @swyx pointed out that agents are the next big AI app, but how good are LLM agents? @veryboldbagel designed 4 benchmarks for LLM too...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇWFH
In April, @swyx pointed out that agents are the next big AI app, but how good are LLM agents?

@veryboldbagel designed 4 benchmarks for LLM tool use, a key skill for agentic behavior. The results may surprise you!

Blog: https://blog.langchain.dev/benchmarking-agent-tool-use/
Docs: https://langchain-ai.github.io/langchain-benchmarks/notebooks/tool_usage/intro.html


LangChain:‚ÄÇ‚öôÔ∏è Agents are the ‚Äúkiller‚Äù LLM app, but building and evaluating agents is hard.

A huge part of agents is tool use, but there aren't enough open-source tool use benchmarks out there.

Today, we are excited to release four new test environments for benchmarking LLMs‚Äô ability to‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1737515077807620499

item.title: Re 12/ ü§ì Final Note on the Charts Error bars computed as standard error, which is why the smaller datasets have wider error bars. Learn more at the...
item.description:
Re 12/ ü§ì Final Note on the Charts

Error bars computed as standard error, which is why the smaller datasets have wider error bars. Learn more at the blog post!

Learn more at the blog post! üìñ https://blog.langchain.dev/benchmarking-agent-tool-use/

Special thanks to @veryboldbagel and @WHinthorn for putting‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1737515101773795350
item.author: LangChain

item.title: Re 11/ ü¶æ Test your own agent Want to test out a new LLM? Agent architecture? Prompting strategy? Run these benchmarks on your own agent by followin...
item.description:
Re 11/ ü¶æ Test your own agent

Want to test out a new LLM? Agent architecture? Prompting strategy? Run these benchmarks on your own agent by following this easy guide: https://langchain-ai.github.io/langchain-benchmarks/notebooks/tool_usage/intro.html
Performance is a function of the whole system. We were only able to clearly run a small‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1737515100381262024
item.author: LangChain

item.title: Re 10/ üí°Observations - Bigger isn't always better: it all depends on the alignment of task ü§ù training data - ü´® The big platforms are still fl...
item.description:
Re 10/ üí°Observations
- Bigger isn't always better: it all depends on the alignment of task ü§ù training data
- ü´® The big platforms are still flaky! Lots of internal server errors we had to work around. We left out some platforms because they were too unreliable still!‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1737515098921664815

item.title: Re 9/ Multiverse Math Results - The older GPT models (from June) and Claude 2.1 are GPT-*-1106 seems to perform worse on this than previous ones - @an...
item.description:
Re 9/ Multiverse Math Results

- The older GPT models (from June) and Claude 2.1 are GPT-*-1106 seems to perform worse on this than previous ones

- @anyscalecompute 's fine-tuned Mistral competes well with OpenAI's models on this one, effectively following functions for these‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1737515097092964600

item.title: Re 8/ Task 4: Multiverse Math Agent must answer simple math problems, üö®BUT it is told the mathematical rules in this scenario are altered. It must ...

Re 8/ Task 4: Multiverse Math

Agent must answer simple math problems, üö®BUT it is told the mathematical rules in this scenario are altered. It must use tools to answer correctly.
